arm_group.description: Subject's habitual hydrogel toric lenses will be evaluated at the first visit and then re-fitted with a pair of silicon hydrogel toric lenses. After 1 week of daily wear, subjects will return for a second and final evaluation.

brief_summary.textblock:
Evaluate the clinical performance of existing wearers of hydrogel toric lenses when refitted
      with Avaira toric silicone hydrogel contact lenses over 1 week of wear.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Performance of Habitual Hydrogel vs. Silicone Hydrogel Toric Contact Lenses

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a 60-subject, single masked, bilateral, study design comparing the fitting
      characteristics of enfilcon A toric lenses against the subjects habitual hydrogel toric
      lenses. Subject's habitual toric lenses will be evaluated at the first visit and then
      re-fitted with a pair of Avaira toric lenses. After 1 week of daily wear, subjects will
      return for a second and final evaluation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Is between 18 and 40 years of age (inclusive)

          -  Has had a self-reported visual exam in the last two years

          -  Is an adapted soft toric contact lens wearer

          -  Has a contact lens spherical prescription between +6.00 to - 8.00 (inclusive)

          -  Have no less than 0.75D of astigmatism and no more than 1.75 D in both eyes.

          -  Can achieve best corrected spectacle distance visual acuity of 20/25 (0.10 logMAR) or
             better in each eye.

          -  Can achieve a distance visual acuity of 20/30 (0.18 logMAR) or better in each eye
             with the study contact lenses.

          -  Has clear corneas and no active ocular disease

          -  Has read, understood and signed the information consent letter.

          -  Patient contact lens refraction should fit within the available parameters of the
             study lenses.

          -  Is willing to comply with the wear schedule (at least 5 days per week, > 8 hours/day
             assuming there are no contraindications for doing so).

          -  Is willing to comply with the visit schedule

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Has a contact lens prescription outside the range of the available parameters of the
             study lenses.

          -  Has a spectacle cylinder less than -0.75D or more than -1.75D of cylinder in either
             eye.

          -  Has a history of not achieving comfortable contact lens wear (5 days per week; > 8
             hours/day)

          -  Has contact lens best corrected distance vision worse than 20/25 (0.10 logMAR) in
             either eye.

          -  Presence of clinically significant (grade 2-4) anterior segment abnormalities

          -  Presence of ocular or systemic disease or need of medications which might interfere
             with contact lens wear.

          -  Slit lamp findings that would contraindicate contact lens wear such as:

               -  Pathological dry eye or associated findings

               -  Pterygium, pinguecula, or corneal scars within the visual axis

               -  Neovascularization > 0.75 mm in from of the limbus

               -  Giant papillary conjunctivitis (GCP) worse than grade 1

               -  Anterior uveitis or iritis (past or present)

               -  Seborrheic eczema, Seborrheic conjunctivitis

               -  History of corneal ulcers or fungal infections

               -  Poor personal hygiene

          -  Has a known history of corneal hypoesthesia (reduced corneal sensitivity)

          -  Has aphakia, keratoconus or a highly irregular cornea.

          -  Has Presbyopia or has dependence on spectacles for near work over the contact lenses.

          -  Has undergone corneal refractive surgery.

          -  Is participating in any other type of eye related clinical or research study.

intervention.description: Subject's habitual hydrogel toric lenses will be evaluated at the first visit and then re-fitted with a pair of silicon hydrogel toric lenses. After 1 week of daily wear, subjects will return for a second and final evaluation.

facility.name: Optometry Research Group (GIO) Optics Department, University of Valencia

clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Performance of Habitual Wearers of Hydrogel Toric Lenses When Refitted With Avaira Toric Silicone Hydrogel Lenses

overall_official.affiliation: Optometry Research Group (GIO) Optics Department, University of Valencia

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair after insertion/settling at 1 week (V2). Rated on a visual analog scale (VAS). (0-10, 0=poor, 10= can't feel)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for lens initial comfort

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed prior to removal of each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair at 1 week (V2). Rated on a visual analog scale (VAS). (0-10, 0=poor, 10= can't feel)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for lens comfort prior to removal

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair at 1 week (V2). Rated on a visual analog scale (VAS).  (0-10, 0=poor, 10= can't feel)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for overall lens comfort

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair at 1 week (V2). Rated on a visual analog scale (VAS). (0-10, 0=very dry, 10= no dryness)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for dryness during the day

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed prior to removal of each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair at 1 week (V2). Rated on a visual analog scale (VAS). (0-10, 0=very dry, 10= no dryness)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for dryness during prior to removal

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair at 1 week (V2). Rated on a visual analog scale (VAS). (0-10, 0=very dry, 10= no dryness)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for overall dryness

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair after insertion/settling at 1 week (V2). Rated on a visual analog scale (VAS). (0-10, 0=poor, 10= very easy)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for lens handling - insertion

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed after removal of each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair at 1 week (V2). Rated on a visual analog scale (VAS). (0-10, 0=poor, 10= very easy)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for lens handling - removal

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair at 1 week (V2). Rated on a visual analog scale (VAS). (0-10, 0=very unstable / excessive movement, 10= very stable / good movement)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for overall lens fit stability

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair at 1 week (V2). Rated on a visual analog scale (VAS). (0-10, 0=completely dissatisfied, 10= very satisfied)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for overall vision satisfaction

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair after insertion/settling at 1 week (V2).Rated on a visual analog scale (VAS). (0-100, 0=extremely poor vision totally blurred, 100= excellent vision totally sharp)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for vision quality at insertion

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair at 1 week (V2). Rated on a visual analog scale (VAS). (0-100, 0=extremely poor vision totally blurred, 100= excellent vision totally sharp)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for vision quality during the day

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair at 1 week (V2). Rated on a visual analog scale (VAS). (0-100, 0=extremely poor vision totally blurred, 100= excellent vision totally sharp)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for vision quality end of the day

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). dispensed pair at 1 week (V2). Rated on a visual analog scale (VAS). (0-100, 0=extremely poor vision totally blurred, 100= excellent vision totally sharp)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for night vision quality

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair after insertion/settling at 1 week (V2). Rated on a visual analog scale (VAS). (0-100, 0=Totally unstable Fluctuating/changing, 100= perfectly stable Not fluctuating/changing)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for vision stability at insertion

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair at 1 week (V2). Rated on a visual analog scale (VAS). (0-100, 0=Totally unstable Fluctuating/changing, 100= perfectly stable Not fluctuating/changing)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for vision stability during the day

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair at 1 week (V2). Rated on a visual analog scale (VAS). (0-100, 0=Totally unstable Fluctuating/changing, 100= perfectly stable Not fluctuating/changing)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for vision stability at end of day

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair at 1 week (V2). Likert scale. (4 choices - completely satisfied, somewhat satisfied, somewhat dissatisfied, completely dissatisfied)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for overall satisfaction - comfort

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair at 1 week (V2). Likert scale. (4 choices - completely satisfied, somewhat satisfied, somewhat dissatisfied, completely dissatisfied)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for overall satisfaction - Dryness

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair at 1 week (V2). Likert scale. (4 choices - completely satisfied, somewhat satisfied, somewhat dissatisfied, completely dissatisfied)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for overall satisfaction - Handling

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair at 1 week (V2). Likert scale. (4 choices - completely satisfied, somewhat satisfied, somewhat dissatisfied, completely dissatisfied)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for overall satisfaction - Vision

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair at 1 week (V2). Likert scale. (4 choices - completely satisfied, somewhat satisfied, somewhat dissatisfied, completely dissatisfied)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for overall satisfaction - Lens Fit

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair at 1 week (V2). Likert scale. (4 choices - completely satisfied, somewhat satisfied, somewhat dissatisfied, completely dissatisfied)
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for overall satisfaction - Overall

primary_outcome.description: Assessed for each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair at 1 week (V2). logMAR - Positive values denote poorer vision, negative values denote better vision than baseline 20/20 value.
primary_outcome.measure: Clinician's objective assessment Monocular High Contrast Distance Visual

primary_outcome.description: Assessed for each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair at 1 week (V2). logMAR - Positive values denote poorer vision, negative values denote better vision than baseline 20/20 value
primary_outcome.measure: Clinician's objective assessment Binocular High Contrast Distance Visual Acuity

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair after insertion/settling at 1 week (V2). Overall performance of the lens in terms of axis stability on primary gaze, during lateral gaze, rotational recovery, and mislocation of the lens on blinking. Likert scale. (0-4, 0=very poor, extreme amount of instability, 4= excellent)
primary_outcome.measure: Clinician's assessment overall lens stability

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair after insertion/settling at 1 week (V2). Overall fit acceptance based on lens fit alone (not comfort or vision). Likert scale. (0-4, 0=should not be worn, 4= perfect)
primary_outcome.measure: Clinician's assessment overall fit acceptance

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed at 1 week (V2). participant's preference for one of two contact lenses. Forced choice - study lenses or Habitual
primary_outcome.measure: Participant's subjective rating for lens pair preference

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair after insertion/settling at 1 week (V2). Lens centration recorded by degree and direction in the primary position. (0-2, 0=centered/optimal, 1=decentered slightly, 2=substantially decentered (>0.5mm))
primary_outcome.measure: Clinician's assessment lens centration

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair after insertion/settling at 1 week (V2). Assessed in primary gaze. (Y=yes, full corneal coverage at all times, N=no, incomplete corneal coverage)
primary_outcome.measure: Clinician's assessment corneal coverage

primary_outcome.description: Surveyed for habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair after insertion/settling at 1 week (V2). Assessed immediately after the blink. (0-4, 0=insufficient, unacceptable movement, 1=minimal, but acceptable movement, 2=optimal movement, 3=moderate, but acceptable movement, 4=excessive, unacceptable movement
primary_outcome.measure: Clinician's assessment Post-Blink Movement

primary_outcome.description: Assessed for habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair after insertion/settling at 1 week (V2). Slit lamp, with 10x magnification. Nasal mislocation is recorded as (+) and temporal as (-). Mislocation of the axis mark on the lens relative to the 6 o'clock position, zero rotation, measured in degrees.
primary_outcome.measure: Clinician's assessment lens orientation in primary position of gaze

primary_outcome.description: Assessed for habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed pair after insertion/settling at 1 week (V2). Slit lamp, with 10x magnification. Lens ability to return to its original position measured 60 seconds after manually rotating the lens 45 degrees temporally.
primary_outcome.measure: Clinician's assessment rotational recovery in degrees after 60 seconds

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Assessed after removal of each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed lens pair at 1 week (V2). Slit lamp with white light, low-medium magnification. (0-4, 0=none/no injection present, 1=very slight, 2=slight, 3=moderate, 4=severe)
secondary_outcome.measure: Clinician's objective assessment anterior ocular health - limbal and bulbar hyperemia

secondary_outcome.description: Assessed after removal of each lens pair. Habitual lens pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed lens pair at 1 week (V2). Slit lamp with white light, low-medium magnification. (0-4, 0=none/no injection present, 1=very slight, 2=slight, 3=moderate, 4=severe)
secondary_outcome.measure: Clinician's objective assessment anterior ocular health - lower palpebral hyperemia

secondary_outcome.description: Assessed after removal of each lens pair. Habitual pair at baseline (V1). Dispensed lens pair at 1 week (V2). Slit lamp with diffuse white light, low-medium magnification. (0-4, 0=none/no infiltrates, 1=Trace/one faint peripheral infiltrate that does not stain, 2=Mild/ a few mild infiltrates, 3=moderate/multiple dense infiltrates, 4=severe/marked infiltrates with overlying staining.)
secondary_outcome.measure: Clinician's objective assessment anterior ocular health -  corneal infiltrates

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject)
